CatDescriptText: Mr. John McKelvy, 912 Anaheim Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "As for the reason, I really can't put my finger on it. For some reason or other they pick on the Negro sections of town, rather than other sections of the city.  I know plenty of white 'after-hours' joints within the city...." rest of the statement unable to read.
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John McKelvy wearing light colored short sleeve shirt with eyeglasses and pens in breast pocket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with hand resting on car parked on Liberty Avenue, Downtown
